Package movement

Class MoveClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • movement.MoveSet
      • movement.MoveClass
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Castle
    public class MoveClass
extends MoveSet
    A set of moves which are dynamically generated based on the position of the piece and other pieces on the board.
    Author:
    Alexander

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoveClass

        public MoveClass​(java.lang.String name,
                 int limit,
                 int dx,
                 int dy,
                 boolean blockable,
                 boolean move,
                 boolean capture,
                 int minMove,
                 int maxMove)
        Makes a class of sliding moves, along a vector in on direction with a certain limit to how far it can go.
        Parameters:
        name - The unlocalized name of this type of move. Typically describes direction. Use to allow activation/deactivation.
        limit - The maximum number of iterations this move allows a piece to move.
        dx - How much this move changes per iteration in the x direction. Typically between -1 through 1 to avoid skipping squares.
        dy - How much this move changes per iteration in the y direction. Typically between -1 through 1 to avoid skipping squares.
        blockable - If this move can be blocked by other pieces in its way. True if it can be blocked.
        move - If this is a move, which can move a piece to an unoccupied space.
        capture - If this is a captures, which can move a piece to an occupied space, capturing that piece in the process.
        minMove - The minimum number of moves a piece can make before it is allowed to move this way (inclusive).
        maxMove - The maximum number of moves a piece can make until it may no longer move this way (inclusive).

      • MoveClass

        public MoveClass​(java.lang.String name,
                 int limit,
                 int dx,
                 int dy,
                 boolean blockable,
                 boolean move,
                 boolean capture)
        Makes a class of sliding moves, along a vector in on direction with a certain limit to how far it can go. By default, has no move number constraints.
        Parameters:
        name - The unlocalized name of this type of move. Typically describes direction. Use to allow activation/deactivation.
        limit - The maximum number of iterations this move allows a piece to move.
        dx - How much this move changes per iteration in the x direction. Typically between -1 through 1 to avoid skipping squares.
        dy - How much this move changes per iteration in the y direction. Typically between -1 through 1 to avoid skipping squares.
        blockable - If this move can be blocked by other pieces in its way. True if it can be blocked.
        move - If this is a move, which can move a piece to an unoccupied space.
        capture - If this is a captures, which can move a piece to an occupied space, capturing that piece in the process.

      • MoveClass

        public MoveClass​(java.lang.String name,
                 int limit,
                 int dx,
                 int dy,
                 boolean blockable)
        Makes a class of sliding moves, along a vector in on direction with a certain limit to how far it can go. By default, has no move number constraints and can both move to empty spaces and capture enemy pieces in occupied spaces.
        Parameters:
        name - The unlocalized name of this type of move. Typically describes direction. Use to allow activation/deactivation.
        limit - The maximum number of iterations this move allows a piece to move.
        dx - How much this move changes per iteration in the x direction. Typically between -1 through 1 to avoid skipping squares.
        dy - How much this move changes per iteration in the y direction. Typically between -1 through 1 to avoid skipping squares.
        blockable - If this move can be blocked by other pieces in its way. True if it can be blocked.

      • active

        public boolean active​(int moveNumber)
        Determines whether moves in this class are active based on "active" state and move number constraints.
        Specified by:
        active in class MoveSet
        Parameters:
        moveNumber - The number of moves the piece has already made.
        Returns:
        Whether moves in this class are able to be made.

      • generateMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Move> generateMoves​(Board board,
                                               Piece piece)
        Get the total list of possible moves based on where this piece is on the board.
        Specified by:
        generateMoves in class MoveSet
        Parameters:
        board - The board this piece is on.
        piece - The piece to check.
        Returns:

      • generateMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Move> generateMoves​(Board board,
                                               Piece piece,
                                               boolean getMoves,
                                               boolean getCaptures)
        Get the total list of possible moves based on where this piece is on the board. Please do not touch this method, it is scary and bad, and if you want to refactor it, make a copy please and overload it or something.
        Specified by:
        generateMoves in class MoveSet
        Parameters:
        board - The board this piece is on.
        piece - The piece to check.
        getMoves - Whether or not to get moves onto blank squares.
        getCaptures - Whether or not to get moves onto occupied squares which contain an enemy piece, which results in a capture.
        Returns:
        The list of all possible moves on this board from this MoveClass.
